summary: The document is a memorandum from 21 August 1974, addressed to Mr. F. I. G. Coleman, concerning an FBI investigation into allegations about CIA activities. It includes results from searches in Office of Security records for specific individuals and organizations, highlighting information on Mitchell Livingston Werbell III and John Patrick Muldoon. Additionally, it references an individual, likely Steve Van Cleave, who falsely claimed CIA affiliation under the guise of the Coca Cola Company.
key_findings: No prior information was found in Office of Security records for Security Defense System, Intelligence Services, Ltd., Advance Security Corporation, or Howard Gibson of Powder Springs, Georgia.

Mitchell Livingston Werbell III had a background with the Office of Strategic Services, known for his activities in the Far East and Caribbean, and was described as a 'wheeler dealer, con-man, arms peddler, and soldier of fortune.'
John Patrick Muldoon's career within the Agency was outlined, including his assignments in the Far East and his retirement status.
An individual, probably Steve Van Cleave, falsely claimed to work for the CIA under the cover of the Coca Cola Company, as noted in Agency cables.
